title: What is the need for fish nitrite or nitrate? - Quora

response.answer_text: You need to research the “nitrogen cycle” There are many many detailed and simple explanations on the internet…. basically it works like a circle: starting with ammonia (left over fish food and fish waste)….. then a set of bacteria that develops in your aquarium that turns the ammonia into nitrite (with an I)….. then another sweet develops that turns nitrites into nitrAtes and you remove the build up of nitrAtes through either weekly/biweekly water changes….. but bedore ANY of this can happen and before you can add ANY fish… you need to “cycle” your aquarium…. That is where (depending on what type of filter you have) either the little bioballs, the ceramic rings or circles, or the sponge if you are using a sponge filter gain the capability to preform the nitrogen cycle you must start with just your basics- tank/stand, heater, thermometer, decorations, substrate and water then you add an ammonia source (like a peice of shrimp… some fish food… and eventually the cycle will begin…. First the ammonia eating bacteria will develop… then the nitrite eating bacteria and then the bacteria that turns nitrite into nitrate and then the nitrate is removed by the water change…. but before even buying a tank you should research the cycle… then the fish you want…. then start looking at tanks and such as certain fish won’t get along with others… you will need certain size tanks for others and certain substrates and special materials for others…. hope that helps a bit! It’s really a simple concept once you do some reading on it!
